lines.text: [Urging Barbara not to lose her virginity]
A man is like a bow-and-arrow, and a woman is like a target. Bow-and-arrow needs practice. Target doesn't.

[after hearing Ms. Romano had a heart attack]
Women don't get heart attacks. They give 'em.
I'm the only girl who has to go to Confession and make up sins.

lines.character: Ed Cooper, Julie's and Barbara's Father

lines.text:
[pretending to pick each other up]
Do you wanna go to your place or mine?
She's one of the most independent women I've ever met.
She's not independent, she one of the most dependent women I've ever seen.
I feel like a woman, I've never felt more like a woman.
